description: The underlying cause of CVE-2023-38039 was identified as a flaw in the curl tool (specifically version 8.3.0) used within Microsoft Windows. This vulnerability allows for a denial of service by consuming all available memory when handling certain HTTP headers. The issue arises when a user is tricked into executing the curl utility directed towards a compromised server. The vulnerability has been addressed in curl version 8.4.0, which is included in the security updates KB-5032192, KB-5032190, and KB-5032189 for various builds of Windows 10 and 11, including build numbers 10.0.22631.2715, 10.0.22621.2715, and 10.0.19045.3693.
